attributes.description: Optional normal status indicator of value with respect to normal range for this value. Often included by lab, even if the normal range itself is not included. Coded by ordinals in series HHH, HH, H, (nothing), L, LL, LLL; see openEHR terminology group  `normal_status`.
attributes.name: normal_status

attributes.description: Optional tagged other reference ranges for this value in its particular measurement context.
attributes.name: other_reference_ranges

functions.meaning: Test if two instances are strictly comparable. Effected in descendants.
functions.name: is_strictly_comparable_to

functions.meaning: True if this quantity has no reference ranges.
functions.name: is_simple

functions.meaning: Value is in the normal range, determined by comparison of the value to `_normal_range_` if present, or by the `_normal_status_` marker if present.
functions.name: is_normal

functions.meaning: True if this Ordered object is less than `_other_`. Redefined in descendants.
functions.name: less_than

meta_info.description: Abstract class defining the concept of ordered values, which includes ordinals as well as true quantities. It defines the functions  `<` and `_is_strictly_comparable_to()_`, the latter of which must evaluate to `True` for instances being compared with the  `<` function, or used as limits in the `DV_INTERVAL<T>` class.
meta_info.name: DV_ORDERED
